sentences.english: The Mäkelä family lives on Puistotie, in Helsinki.

sentences.finnish: Heidän koti on korkeassa harmaassa kerrostalossa.
sentences.english: Their home is in a tall grey apartment building.

sentences.finnish: Valoisassa asunnossa on kolme huonetta, keittiö ja parveke.
sentences.english: The bright apartment has three rooms, a kitchen, and a balcony.
The apartment does not have a sauna.

sentences.finnish: Isossa lastenhuoneessa on kaksi sänkyä, vaatekaappi ja suuri vaaleanpunainen lelulaatikko.
sentences.english: The large children's room has two beds, a wardrobe, and a large light pink toy box.
Emma's toys are in the box.

sentences.finnish: Huoneessa on myös kirjoituspöytä ja työtuoli, koska Kalle on jo koulussa.
sentences.english: The room also has a desk and an office chair, because Kalle is already in school.
There is a soft rug on the floor.

sentences.finnish: Emma istuu usein matolla ja lukee kirjaa.
sentences.english: Emma often sits on the rug and reads a book.

sentences.finnish: Isän ja äidin makuuhuoneessa on vain leveä sänky ja kaksi matalaa yöpöytää, koska huone on aika pieni.
sentences.english: The parents' bedroom has only a wide bed and two low bedside tables, because the room is quite small.

sentences.finnish: Seinällä on Emman ja Kallen valokuvat.
sentences.english: On the wall are photos of Emma and Kalle.
The living room is bright and cozy.

sentences.finnish: Siellä on ruskea sohva, kaksi vanhaa nojatuolia ja sohvapöytä.
sentences.english: There is a brown sofa, two old armchairs, and a coffee table.
The television is in a large bookshelf.

sentences.finnish: Mäkelät istuvat usein illalla sohvalla ja katsovat televisiota.
sentences.english: The Mäkeläs often sit on the sofa in the evening and watch television.
